quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Creatures
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, people, opening. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many siblings did William Shakespeare have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: In All Creatures Great and Small, Mr. Worley had six pigs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the book All Creatures Great and Small, what was Angus Griers way of getting all the attention for himself?

options.text: James would tell him that he was going to do something one way, then Grier would tell him to do it another way which would lead him doing it wrong, and then Grier did it the way James was going to at first.
He treated James as a pack mule.
James killed the animal for Grier and while the owner would go crying, Grier would get a new animal that looked exactly alike and replace it and then pretend he had revived it.
He sacked James in front of lots of people and acted as if he were a runaway criminal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James would tell him that he was going to do something one way, then Grier would tell him to do it another way which would lead him doing it wrong, and then Grier did it the way James was going to at first.

questions.question: In the book All Creatures Great and Small, which of Siegfrieds possessions does Tristan keep destroying?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vehicles

questions.question: Where did William Shakespeare grow up?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stratford-upon-Avon

questions.question: Which novel has the opening lines, My name was Salmon, like the fish; first name Susie. I was fourteen when I was murdered on December 6, 1963.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lovely Bones

questions.question: On May 11, 1996, eight people died while trying to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, including famed mountain guides Rob Hall and Scott Fischer. Jon Krakauer was one of the survivors. What is the name of Krakauers book that gives his first person account of the events that led to one of the deadest days ever on Mount Everest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Into Thin Air

questions.question: Who were William Shakespeares parents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John and Mary Shakespeare

questions.question: What were the names of William Shakespeares three children, two of whom were twins, a boy and a girl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Susanna, Hamnet and Judith

questions.question: In the book All Creatures Great and Small, Mrs. Pumphreys dogs name is Tricki Woo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 2008, EW.com asked readers for their choice for favorite author of the last 25 years. Which author
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. K. Rowling

questions.question: All Creatures Great and Small comprises James Herriots first two novels, If Only They Could Talk and It Shouldnt Happen to a Vet. What is the names of the editions in which the rest of James Herriots other books were published in the United states?

options.text: All Things Clean and Dirty, and All Things Sick and Gross.
All Things Loud and Annoying, and All Things Quite and Silent.
All Things Technical and Universal, and All Things Large and Small.
All Things Bright and Beautiful, and All Things Wise and Wonderful.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All Things Bright and Beautiful, and All Things Wise and Wonderful.

questions.question: In the book All Creatures Great and Small, what was Tristans favorite type of cigarettes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodbine

questions.question: In All Creatures Great and Small, James wanted to be a small animal surgeon before he became a veterinarian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the veterinarians full name in the book All Creatures Great and Small?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. James Herriot

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Dean Koontz and Hermione
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, hermione, middle. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the occupation of Hermiones parents in the Harry Potter books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dentists

questions.question: Is fictional character Hermione Granger made a prefect?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which of these is not one of the many pseudonyms used by American writer Dean Koontz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris McCarthy

questions.question: What is Dean Koontzs middle name?

options.text: He does not have a middle name.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray

questions.question: Dean Koontz has undergone hair transplant surgery.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who does Hermione turn into, using the Polyjuice Potion in Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Millicent Bullstrodes cat

questions.question: Who is Trixie Koontz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dean Koontz dog

questions.question: Dean Koontz is a confirmed bachelor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What 70s television series did Dean Koontz write an episode for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CHiPs

questions.question: In what year did Dean Koontzs first novel debut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1968

questions.question: Did Hermione punch Ron in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What did Shakespeare leave to his wife Anne in his will?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his second best bed

questions.question: William Shakespeare died April 23, 1616.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is not one of Dean Koontzs pseudonyms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marion Marquart

questions.question: What was the name of Shakespeares theatre, where his acting company performed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Globe Theater

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Ancient Mariner and Rime
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, sail, ship. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what book does Hermione develop a crush on Gilderoy Lockhart?

options.text: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone
Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

questions.question: What does the Mariner from The Rime of the Ancient Mariner see on the horizon that gives the crew a fleeting sense of hope?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Another ship

questions.question: What does the Mariner do that begins to lift the curse in the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner?

options.text: He rides on the back of a dolphin.
He blesses the water snakes and says a prayer.
He clicks his heels three times saying Theres no place like home!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He blesses the water snakes and says a prayer.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about Hermione Granger from the Harry Potter books?

options.text: She enjoys drinking the Polyjuice Potion.
She was born in a muggle family.
She can turn into a rabbit.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was born in a muggle family.

questions.question: Finish this stanza from the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner:

options.text: d all the boards did shrink,
And then the ship did sink.
And boy did that water stink!
And the men were on the brink.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nor any drop to drink.

questions.question: How long did the Mariner sail alone after the crew had died in The Rime of the Ancient Mariner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seven days and seven nights

questions.question: What did the Ancient Mariner from The Rime of the Ancient Mariner do that cursed the crew and the ship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He killed the albatross

questions.question: What did the crew of the ship in The Rime of the Ancient Mariner put around the Mariners neck to shame him?

options.text: A sign that said Kick me
A rock tied to a rope

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The albatross

questions.question: What creatures does the Mariner watch swimming in the sea beyond the shadow of the ship in The Rime of the Ancient Mariner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water snakes

questions.question: In The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, what creature brings good luck to the ship and follows it out of the icebergs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An albatross

questions.question: In the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, the Ancient Mariner tells his tale to a person he pulls aside from what event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A wedding

questions.question: In the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, how many men died onboard the ship when the Moon rose?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 200

questions.question: Which of these statements is NOT true about Harry Potter character Hermione Granger?

options.text: She was named after J.K Rowlings best friend.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was named after J.K Rowlings best friend.

questions.question: What happens after the Mariner from The Rime of the Ancient Mariner awakes after a blessed sleep?

options.text: A wind blows out of the East..

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A storm ravages the ship.

questions.question: How did the Mariners ship end up in the Antarctic Ocean in the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner?

options.text: It was blown south by a storm.
They were shipping supplies to Antarctica.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was blown south by a storm.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Ancient Mariner and Poem
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, mitchard, globe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Jacquelyn Mitchard’s novel, which was the first book chosen for Oprah’s Book Club in 1996, was made into a 1999 Michele Pfeiffer and Treat Williams movie.

options.text: The Deep End of the Ocean

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Deep End of the Ocean

questions.question: Where does the wind blow the ship after the conversation in the beginning of Part 6 of The Rime of the Ancient Mariner is over?

options.text: Back to the Mariners home country

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Back to the Mariners home country

questions.question: What Shakespeare historical play was being performed at the Globe Theatre in 1613 when a fire broke out from a misguided theatrical cannon shot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry VIII

questions.question: Who was in the boat that rowed nearer the Mariners ship in the harbor at the end of the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner?

options.text: The Pilot, his daughter, and the Hermit
The Pilot, his son, and the Hermit

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pilot, his son, and the Hermit

questions.question: What best-selling American author, born Howard Allen O’Brien, created the vampire Lestat de Lioncourt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Rice

questions.question: At the end of the poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, the man who the Mariner told his story to does what?

options.text: Goes with the Mariner back to the ship
Goes home, and gets up the next morning wiser than before

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goes home, and gets up the next morning wiser than before

questions.question: A.A. Milne created the character of Christopher Robin as one of Winnie-the-Pooh’s best friends and based him on his real life son, Christopher Robin Milne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the beginning of Part 6 of The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, who is having a conversation with whom?

options.text: The mariner and the Second Voice
The First Voice and the Second Voice

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The First Voice and the Second Voice

questions.question: Sporting a male pseudonym, what female French novelist maintained a romantic relationship with Frederic Chopin from 1837-1847?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Sand

questions.question: Known as the “Sage of Concord”, what American Transcendentalist owned the land where Henry David Thoreau built his cabin near Walden Pond in Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph Waldo Emerson

questions.question: Based on Audrey Niffenegger’s novel, this 2009 movie starring Eric Bana and Rachel McAdams chronicles a romance over time between Henry DeTamble and Clare Abshire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Time Travelers Wife

questions.question: With characters such as Fiver, Bigwig, and General Woundwort, what Richard Adams heroic fantasy novel follows the story of a small group of rabbits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Watership Down

questions.question: In the English poem The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, which dead crew member helped the Mariner pull on a rope after the crew rose from the dead?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mariners nephew

questions.question: Often coming in at number one on 100 Best Novels of the 20th Century lists, what is the name of the James Joyce book that depicts a day in the life of Leopold Bloom?

options.text: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses

questions.question: Which 19th century epistolary novel by Wilkie Collins is considered to be the first modern detective novel in the English language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Moonstone

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Piers Anthony
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the slang term used for romance novels in literature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bodice Rippers

questions.question: This small publishing company is noted for its defence for freedom of speech. Can you name the publishing company that took on the United States Postal Service for the right to publish Lady Chatterleys Lover?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grove Press

questions.question: Which anti-war science fiction novel by Kurt Vonnegut follows the journeys through time of American soldier, Billy Pilgrim, mostly set in Dresden, Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slaughterhouse Five

questions.question: This French writers grandmother was an Afro-Caribbean slave who married a white nobleman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexandre Dumas

questions.question: What is the name of the mythical land that is the basis of Piers Anthonys most famous fantasy book series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xanth

questions.question: Piers Anthonys fantasy land of Xanth looks strikingly similar to what southern state of the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florida

questions.question: Apart from writing a bestselling horror fiction, he also worked as an acting and business manager of Irvings Lyceum Theatre, London. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bram Stoker

questions.question: Which of these is not a book from the Apprentice Adept series by Piers Anthony?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prostho Plus

questions.question: Who did Piers Anthony collaborate with to write the Kelvin of Rudd series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert E. Margroff

questions.question: Piers Anthony wrote a historical/fantasy novel about Native Americans called Tatham Mound.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1972 Kathleen Woodiwiss published a historical romance that took a historical romantic couple actually into the bedroom. Can you name the book that begins the saga of the Birmingham Family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Flame and the Flower

questions.question: What was the title of Piers Anthonys famous horror novel written in 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Firefly

questions.question: With what book did Erica Jong debut in 1973 that introduced the character Isadora Zelda White Strollerman Wing and Isadoras search for emotional and sexual fulfilment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear of Flying

questions.question: What is Piers Anthonys real last name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacob

questions.question: Which one of these fantasy books by Piers Anthony is not part of a series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercycle

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Door
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, rolands, bedridden. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the only brother of the sister authors Charlotte, Emily and Anne Bronte?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Branwell

questions.question: In the novel The Drawing of the Three, Roland doesnt find another companion through the third door. Instead he finds an adversary named Jack Mort who is closely linked to some of Rolands companions. What was the label on the third door?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pusher

questions.question: The novel The Drawing of the Three begins seven days after the end of The Gunslinger novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the opening scene of The Drawing of the Three Roland is attacked by a strange creature. What type of creature of our world did it resemble?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lobster

questions.question: Which of the following Irish writers did not receive the Nobel Prize for Literature in the 20th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Joyce

questions.question: The second door in the novel The Drawing of the Three leads to Odetta Holmes, a black woman who is involved with the civil rights movement. She has a split personality that leads to some interesting confrontations with her new companions. What is the label on the second door?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lady of Shadows

questions.question: English Baron George Bulwer-Lytton liked to use the words the last in the titles of his books. Which of the following books was not written by him?

options.text: The Last Days of the Barons and Harold
The Last Days of the Saxon Kings

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Last of the Mochicans

questions.question: What white whale does Captain Ahab seek in Herman Melvilles novel Moby Dick?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sperm Whale

questions.question: Who penned the childrens story The Old Man of Lochnager?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince Charles

questions.question: Rolands encounter with Jack Mort in The Drawing of the Three caused the characters of Odetta Holmes and Detta Walker to merge together. What was the name of the woman who was formed from this fusion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Susannah

questions.question: Ernest Hemingway fictionalized his experiences of World War I in this book which tells the story of an American soldier, Lt. Fredric Henry, who falls in love with a British nurse, named Catherine Barkley.

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Farewell to Arms

questions.question: She wrote her only best-seller novel bedridden, with a broken ankle only for her amusement, keeping it secret from her friends. Who is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Mitchell

questions.question: According to many scholars, Miguel Cervantes penned the first modern novel. What is its title?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Quixote

questions.question: In the book The Drawing of the Three, during his battle with the creature on the beach Roland suffers a loss. What is it?

options.text: Most of his right big toe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The first door described in the book The Drawing of the Three leads Roland to Eddie Dean, a heroin addict in the process of smuggling some drugs. What is the label on this first door?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Prisoner
